name: Aethusa cynapium
Modalities: Worse: 3 to four am and evenings; warmth

Urine: Cutting pain in bladder, with frequent urging
Stool: Undigested, thin, greenish, preceded by colic, with tenesmus, and followed by exhaustion and drowsiness
Obstinate constipation; feels as if all bowel action is lost
Cholera infantum; child cold, clammy, stupid, with staring eyes and dilated pupils
Head: Occipital pain extending down spine; better lying down and by pressure
Head symptoms relieved by expelling flatus  and by stool
Vertigo with drowsiness, with palpitation; head hot after vertigo ceases
Hair feels pulled
Feels bound up, or in a vise
Stomach: Regurgitation of about an half hour after eating
Vomiting, with sweat and great weakness, accompanied by anguish and distress, followed by sleepiness
Stomach feels turned upside down, with burning feeling up to the chest
Intolerance of milk; vomiting as soon as swallowed or in large curds
Violent vomiting of a white frothy matter
Tearing pains in the stomach extending to oesophagus
Abdomen: Colic, followed by exhaustion and drowsiness
Cold, internal and external, with aching pain in bowels
Mouth: Burning and pustules in throat, with difficult swallowing
Respiratory: Difficult, oppressed, anxious respiration; crampy constriction
Eyes: Rolling of eyes on falling asleep
Face: Expression anxious, full of pain; linea nasalis marked
Nose: Herpetic eruption on tip of nose
Stopped up with much thick mucus
Ears: Sense of something hot from ears
Heart: Violent palpitation, with vertigo, headache and restlessness
Mind: Sees rats, cats, dogs, etc. unconscious, delirious
Idiocy may alternate with furor and irritability
Inability to think, to fix the attention
Back: Want of power to stand up or hold head up
Back feels as if in a vise
Sleep: Dozing after vomiting or stool child is so exhausted, it falls asleep at once
Disturbed by violent startling; cold perspiration
Female: Swelling of mammary glands, with lancinating pains
Skin: Surface of body covered with clammy sweat
Skin of hands dry and shrunken

details: The characteristic symptoms relate mainly to the brain and nervous system, connected with gastrointestinal disturbance. Anguish, crying, and expression of uneasiness and discontent, lead to this remedy most frequently in disease in children, during dentition, summer complaint, when, with the diarrhoea, there is MARKED INABILITY TO DIGEST MILK, and poor circulation. Symptoms set in with VIOLENCE.
